page.title: 02WOODLAND TO HOUSING
page.content: The area may be divided into two parts_the valley bottom with its springs and rivers and the Ragstone slope running from N.W to S.E. Most arable farming is found in the valley while the Ragstone slope has always tended to be rocky and covered with woodland. This rocky substrate has often caused difficulty for ploughing but modern machinery is more capable of removing rocks that would have broken many ploughs in the past. Modern fertilisers have also helped to make this region more useable so that more of this area can be cultivated. In the Kingswood locality many acres of sweet chestnut coppice have been removed and land devoted to new housing estates. This is due largely to the reduction of Leeds Castle estate and to its development potential.
